product_name: KALANDO Wireless Bluetooth Colorful LED Water Speaker with Dancing Fountain Light Show Sound for PC, MP3 Player, Laptops, Smartphone Black
explanation: The cradle-to-gate CO2e emissions for the KALANDO Wireless Bluetooth Colorful LED Water Speaker are estimated based on typical emissions for similar electronic products. The calculation includes: 1) Raw material extraction and processing: This involves the extraction and processing of materials like plastics, metals, and electronic components, which typically contribute around 2 kg CO2e. 2) Transportation of raw materials to the manufacturing facility: Given the product's origin in China, transportation emissions are estimated at 0.5 kg CO2e. 3) Manufacturing and assembly processes: The manufacturing of electronic components and assembly of the product contribute approximately 2.7 kg CO2e. These estimates are based on industry averages for small electronic devices and do not account for specific efficiencies or inefficiencies in the actual production process of this specific product.

product_name: Diamond ATI Radeon HD5870 Eyefinity 6 Edition 2048 MB GDDR5 PCI-Express Video Card 5870PE52G
explanation: The cradle-to-gate CO2e emissions for the Diamond ATI Radeon HD5870 Eyefinity 6 Edition video card are estimated based on typical emissions data for similar electronics products. The emissions are broken down into the following phases: 1) Raw material extraction and processing: This includes the mining and processing of metals and other materials used in the video card, such as aluminum, copper, and silicon, which are energy-intensive processes. 2) Transportation of raw materials to the manufacturing facility: This involves the emissions from transporting raw materials from their extraction sites to the manufacturing plant, typically using diesel-powered vehicles. 3) Manufacturing and assembly processes: This includes the energy used in the manufacturing plant to assemble the video card, including the production of the printed circuit board, soldering of components, and testing. The total estimated CO2e emissions for these phases are approximately 150 kg, based on industry averages for similar electronics products.

product_name: Case for iPad Pro 12.9 2022/2021/2020/2018, Blue Flowers Shockproof Protective Case for iPad Pro 12.9 6th/5th/4th/3rd Gen, [Auto Sleep/Wake] [with Pencil Holder] Adjustable Stand iPad Case Folio Cover
explanation: The cradle-to-gate CO2e emissions for the iPad Pro 12.9 case are estimated based on the materials and processes involved. The case is primarily made of PU leather and TPU, both of which are synthetic materials derived from petrochemicals. The production of PU leather typically emits around 3.8 kg CO2e per kg, and TPU emits about 5.5 kg CO2e per kg. Assuming the case weighs approximately 0.54 kg (1.19 pounds), and considering the proportions of materials used, the raw material extraction and processing phase contributes significantly to the emissions. Transportation of raw materials to the manufacturing facility is estimated to add a small amount, around 0.1 kg CO2e, based on typical distances and modes of transport. The manufacturing and assembly processes, including 3D relief printing and assembly, are estimated to contribute around 0.5 kg CO2e, considering energy use and efficiency. Overall, the total cradle-to-gate emissions are estimated to be approximately 2.5 kg CO2e.

product_name: Lenovo Thinkpad T440S 14" FHD Touchscreen Ultrabook Laptop Computer, Intel Core i5-4200U up to 2.6GHz, 8GB RAM, 240GB SSD, WiFi, Bluetooth, USB 3.0, Windows 10 Professional (Renewed)
explanation: The cradle-to-gate CO2e emissions for the Lenovo Thinkpad T440S are estimated based on typical emissions data for laptops. The emissions are broken down into three main phases: 1) Raw material extraction and processing, which includes mining and refining metals like aluminum, copper, and rare earth elements used in the laptop's components, contributing approximately 60 kg CO2e. 2) Transportation of raw materials to the manufacturing facility, which involves emissions from shipping and logistics, contributing around 20 kg CO2e. 3) Manufacturing and assembly processes, which include energy consumption during the production of components such as the motherboard, display, and battery, as well as the final assembly of the laptop, contributing about 70 kg CO2e. These estimates are based on industry averages and specific data for similar electronic products, as detailed data for this specific model is not available.

product_name: Ceeyali Reusable Hook and Loop Fastening Cable Ties Cable Straps for Home Office Tablet PC TV Electronics Wires Organizer Management (15 Pack 8 inch + 15 Pack 12 inch)
explanation: The cradle-to-gate CO2e emissions for the Ceeyali Reusable Hook and Loop Fastening Cable Ties are calculated based on the following phases: 1. Raw material extraction and processing: The primary material is fabric, which involves the production of synthetic fibers. The CO2e emissions for synthetic fiber production are estimated to be around 2.5 kg CO2e per kg of fabric. Given the product weight of 3.2 ounces (approximately 0.09 kg), the emissions for raw material extraction and processing are approximately 0.225 kg CO2e. 2. Transportation of raw materials to manufacturing facility: Assuming an average transportation distance and mode (e.g., truck), the emissions are estimated to be around 0.05 kg CO2e. 3. Manufacturing and assembly processes: The manufacturing of hook and loop fasteners involves energy consumption for cutting, sewing, and packaging. This is estimated to contribute around 0.2 kg CO2e. 4. Until the product leaves the factory gate: This includes final packaging and preparation for shipping, contributing an additional 0.025 kg CO2e. Summing these phases, the total cradle-to-gate CO2e emissions are approximately 0.5 kg.

product_name: HYS 3.5mm Police Listen Only Acoustic Tube Earpiece with One Pair Medium Earmolds for Speaker Mics
explanation: The cradle-to-gate CO2e emissions for the HYS 3.5mm Police Listen Only Acoustic Tube Earpiece are estimated based on the following phases: 1) Raw material extraction and processing: The earpiece is primarily made of rubber and plastic components, which typically have a moderate carbon footprint due to the energy-intensive processes involved in extracting and processing these materials. 2) Transportation of raw materials to the manufacturing facility: Given the product's origin in China, transportation emissions are considered for shipping raw materials to the manufacturing site. 3) Manufacturing and assembly processes: The manufacturing of electronic components and assembly of the earpiece involve energy consumption, contributing to the overall emissions. The total estimated CO2e emissions for these phases amount to approximately 0.5 kg, considering the small size and weight of the product, as well as typical emissions factors for similar electronic accessories.

product_name: ASUS VivoBook Thin and Light Laptop, 15.6" HD Display, Intel Core i3-1005G1 Processor, USB Type-C, Webcam, Wi-Fi, HDMI, Windows 11 Home, Gray (12GB RAM | 256GB SSD)
explanation: The cradle-to-gate CO2e emissions for the ASUS VivoBook laptop are estimated based on typical emissions data for similar electronic products. The calculation includes emissions from raw material extraction and processing, transportation of raw materials to the manufacturing facility, and the manufacturing and assembly processes. For raw materials, the extraction and processing of metals like aluminum, copper, and rare earth elements used in the laptop's components contribute significantly to emissions. Transportation emissions are considered based on average distances and modes of transport used in the electronics supply chain. Manufacturing emissions account for energy consumption in assembling components such as the motherboard, display, and battery. The total estimated CO2e emissions of 150 kg reflect these combined phases, excluding distribution, use, and end-of-life disposal.

product_name: SMDV Diffuser-50 -- Professional 20x20" Rigid Softbox for Canon Flash
explanation: The cradle-to-gate CO2e emissions for the SMDV Diffuser-50 are calculated by considering the following phases: 1) Raw material extraction and processing: The main materials used in the product are nylon for the softbox shell and diffusers, fiberglass for the frame, and metal for the speedring. Nylon production is energy-intensive, contributing significantly to emissions. Fiberglass and metal processing also add to the carbon footprint. 2) Transportation of raw materials to the manufacturing facility: The transportation emissions depend on the distance and mode of transport. Assuming typical distances and modes (e.g., truck transport), this phase contributes moderately to the total emissions. 3) Manufacturing and assembly processes: The assembly involves snapping rods into the speedring and attaching the diffusers, which are relatively low-energy processes. However, the energy used in the manufacturing facility, likely powered by electricity, contributes to emissions. 4) Until the product leaves the factory gate: Packaging and final assembly steps are included here, with minimal additional emissions. The total estimated CO2e emissions for these phases are approximately 5.2 kg.

product_name: RasTech Raspberry Pi 3 Model B+ Starter Kit with 32GB Micro SD Card, Power Supply with ON/Off, Case, Micro SDHC Card, Cooling Fan, HDMI Cable, Network Cable, Hestsinks, Card Reader, Screwdriver
explanation: The cradle-to-gate CO2e emissions for the RasTech Raspberry Pi 3 Model B+ Starter Kit are estimated based on the following components and processes: 1) Raw material extraction and processing: The main components include the Raspberry Pi board, micro SD card, power supply, HDMI cable, network cable, heatsinks, cooling fan, and case. The emissions from raw material extraction and processing for these electronic components are significant due to the energy-intensive nature of mining and refining metals like copper, aluminum, and silicon. 2) Transportation of raw materials to the manufacturing facility: The transportation emissions are calculated based on the average distance raw materials travel to reach the manufacturing facility, typically involving shipping and trucking, which contribute to CO2 emissions. 3) Manufacturing and assembly processes: The manufacturing of electronic components involves energy-intensive processes such as soldering, assembly, and testing, which contribute to the overall CO2e emissions. 4) Until the product leaves the factory gate: This includes packaging and any final quality checks before the product is shipped to distributors. The total estimated CO2e emissions for these phases amount to approximately 5.2 kg per unit, based on industry averages for similar electronic products.

product_name: USB 3.0 Extension Cable 20Ft, TanGuYu USB 3.0 Extender Cord Type A Male to A Female for Oculus VR, Playstation, Xbox, USB Flash Drive, Card Reader, Hard Drive,Keyboard, Printer, Scanner, Camera
explanation: The cradle-to-gate CO2e emissions for the USB 3.0 Extension Cable are estimated based on the following phases: 1) Raw material extraction and processing: The cable is primarily made of copper, PVC, and gold-plated connectors. Copper extraction and processing are energy-intensive, contributing significantly to emissions. PVC production also involves emissions from the use of fossil fuels. 2) Transportation of raw materials: The raw materials are transported to the manufacturing facility, typically involving emissions from diesel-powered trucks. 3) Manufacturing and assembly processes: The manufacturing of the cable involves energy consumption for processes such as extrusion of PVC, assembly of components, and quality testing. The emissions are calculated based on typical energy use in electronics manufacturing. 4) Until the product leaves the factory gate: This includes packaging and any final quality checks. The total estimated CO2e emissions for these phases are approximately 1.5 kg per cable, based on industry averages for similar electronic products.
